author: sky.cactus
content: IMO, website's shouldn't be prescriptive about how wide is comfortable to read for everyone.  Everyone is different and the user is in 100% control of how wide their browser window is so there is no reason/need to artificially waste screen real estate and force everyone to view the page at the same reading width.

author: sky.cactus
content: I spend a significant portion of my day manually *removing* width constraints off of websites because I prefer a larger width for most things than others.  It is far easier for someone who likes a "very thin horizontal reading view" to shrink their browser window than it is for those who like wider reading views to go and edit HTML to remove artificial constraints.
